website_summaries.verdict: For those who demand lots of interior padding to keep their guitar safe, this bag is for you.
pros: 5 mm of interior padding ensures your guitar is protected against shocks and shakes
Polyester construction limits rips and tears
Ergonomic backpack straps are comfortable and easy to adjust
Large bag offers sufficient space for most acoustic guitars
cons: Lack of waterproof construction makes it tough to safeguard your guitar in rain, snow and other inclement weather

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price, but certainly not road hardened
customer_reviews.text: It is basically a "dust" case. Not much padding but adequate enough if you don't travel with it. Inadequate road protection, in my opinion. I won't put my Stratocaster in the case, but I did put my much cheaper Tele "style" guitar in it. It works. For the price point, not bad. It is better than a plain old guitar sleeve. It has back carrying straps on it, that I would not dare to use. It also has a cool red embroided Fender logo on it. One thing it does not have, that would be nice, is a hanger strap on top.
customer_reviews.author: RUOK

customer_reviews.title: Fits a squire stratocaster perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Fits a '18 Fender Squire Affinity Stratocaster perfectly, almost like a guitar sock. Strong fabric durable well made. No padding though, definitely not made for tossing around. Basically to carry around and keep your guitar clean and dust proof. A few Fender logos and a pocket for your use.
customer_reviews.author: studpuppie

customer_reviews.title: Nothing fancy but great value and nothing to complain about
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy but great value and nothing to complain about. Will work for Jazz, P-Bass, Mustang and Jaguar style Fender basses.
customer_reviews.author: GingerMountain

customer_reviews.title: Fits P-bass
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Squier P-bass perfectly. Doesn't offer much padding, but it will definitely help protect against scratches, minor dings, and it's way easier to carry my bass around with this. It also has a nice little zippered pocket on the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Conenient for local gigs
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag/ soft case. Its pretty simple. Has a big pouch in the front with a zipper where you can store cables. I would not take it on the road as thats a little too much abuse for it to take. For the local gig, its fine, especially if youre parking and having to walk a bit to the venue, it's much easier to have this on your back than to carry a heavy case. Well made. I kind of love it and cant believe it took me so long to get one.
customer_reviews.author: A. Landa

customer_reviews.title: A Great Gig Bag For The Price
customer_reviews.text: This Gig Bag looks nice and has solid zippers and a decent amount of padding. We bought it to give to a boy we are teaching guitar to. He only had a cardboard box for his guitar. It delighted him and we're satisfied it will provide much better protection for his instrument with an ample pouch for teaching materials, picks and accessories. A pretty good deal overall.
customer_reviews.author: SRAdie

customer_reviews.title: Fit well for my bass guitar
customer_reviews.text: The bags are little bit bigger then I expect but it’s good for me more then I expected for my bass guitar love this bag compare some other ones I try they don’t fit to well I have tons of room in my bass guitar bag I will be getting more bags down the road when I need them
customer_reviews.author: Capano

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Needed a gig bag for my Fender P-Bass. The gig bag works fine, but is not the sturdiest. Good value for the money. I can fit my music folder, (2) 10 foot cables, and the clip on tuner in the accessory pouch. I really like the back pack straps on the gig bag. The back pack feature really pays off when you have to carry a 55 pound amplifier up stairs. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: BrewingRAGE26

customer_reviews.title: Fits Seagull S12
customer_reviews.text: Having purchased a Seagull S12 at a good price from Amazon to be my "beater" guitar (one that I leave out on a stand rather than in a hard case in the bedroom), I was looking for an inexpensive gig bag for transport. This bag isn't pretty, but it fits the 12-string Seagull, includes a zippered pocket large enough for music, and costs less than the other options I was considering.
customer_reviews.author: TE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my Fender P bass. I really like the backpack straps for the days I have to ride my motorcycle to practice. The extra large pocket is handy for sheet music. I would definitely recommend this case.
customer_reviews.author: JT and LL Coker

customer_reviews.title: It's OK for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's "meh".... for $30 bucks I can't expect much. very thin padding, I was hoping for a bit more. Fabric seems strong, storage pocket is deep enough for additional power cables and miscellaneous. Not a huge loss. Bottom line is it's good enough for A to B moving, but padding is thin so a bang around could equate to a mark on the guitar....but then again, it will give it some mojo...
customer_reviews.author: homertoeclipper

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke away from the gig bag before first use
customer_reviews.text: I admit I bought a “used” version of this gig bag. However after packing the Fender Strat up for the first time use, I noticed that the zipper to the storage compartment had already broken away from the gig bag. Returned it immediately. I am a cheapskate but from now on I won’t buy the bottom of the barrel, good lesson. Going to try the Fender F610 series which is a step up from this cheapo series.
customer_reviews.author: Keef F

customer_reviews.title: Bunk zipper
customer_reviews.text: Love the design. Could use more padding on the bottom, I'm scared of setting my bass down any other way than very gently .Also when i opened it the zipper was already coming off the sticking on the pocket. For the price i didnt complain or return. I still use it I"m just VERY careful with it. Will upgrade to something more padded very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great gig bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is one the nicer gig bags I’ve found in this price range. Good amount of padding compared to many others I’ve tried. Good amount of storage also. This isn’t exactly like the version that runs about $40 which has more padding but it’s still a decent bag for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Schluter

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: It is a great design and looks great. It will not protect from a drop as padding is not a lot as other cases, but for my purpose it was great. I give 5 because of design and how it looks.
customer_reviews.author: Alonso Flores

customer_reviews.title: Good soft case
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of basses and sometimes need to transport them, after researching for a bit I found this one to be the best value. It fits my basses, it looks nice, and does what it's supposed to do... Even if I don't own a Fender lol
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Get out
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like gig bags and I think guitar companies should always include a case to protect your babies.
customer_reviews.author: Don Custer

customer_reviews.title: Fits the China model Fender Strat
customer_reviews.text: I just needed a standard gig bag to fit the China model Stratocaster and didn't need anything high quality. When I got it the gig bag fits perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Josephs

customer_reviews.title: Campground Special
customer_reviews.text: Fit my Fender cc60s like a glove. Fast shipping too. Perfect. Use it on a stand so shouldn’t get beat up. If you’re traveling I’d put in on the top of the stack. Great for getting to the campground.
customer_reviews.author: Eparhdrider

customer_reviews.title: perfect bag for my bass guitar
customer_reviews.text: great gig bag to keep an instrument in your home to protect it from changes in the home climate . if you travel with you instrument in the bag it is not going to protect it like a hard case but pack it so stuff doesnt fall on it when u drive
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Gelbman

customer_reviews.title: Weak zipper
customer_reviews.text: Bought for grandson. On 3rd time zipping the case shut the tab on zipper broke leaving the case useless. Not durable zipper.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the $
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the $ ... fits my fender electric guitar fine. Seems to have good padding / protection. No issues. A+
customer_reviews.author: grahamgg

customer_reviews.title: Cases fit my basses perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the money, well insulated to protect the basses. No problem fitting the two basses I needed them for. Zippers worked as they were supposed to. I would purchase this case again
customer_reviews.author: RT SLINGER

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my 5-string fretless Moses Jazz bass. Fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Pinky

customer_reviews.title: Kinda small but nice case
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag but kinda small with the taper at the top. Case is really thin but feels like it will be durable.
customer_reviews.author: randy cramer

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality, but not much protection
customer_reviews.text: This bag is well made, but the foam material is so thin that it offers little protection to the instrument inside the bag. I'll use it to travel to a friend's house for a rehearsal, but I would never use it for any serious travel where bumps are likely.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Armbruster

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality and sleek design
customer_reviews.text: I love this case! Adaquetly protects my guitar and holds all needed accessories (tuner, capo, cables etc.).
customer_reviews.author: Wanye

customer_reviews.title: didn’t know they got this thin
customer_reviews.text: this is the least padded gig bag I’ve ever come across. If we didn’t have an immediate need for one it would be returned
customer_reviews.author: Cherry Hill Blues Festival

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit
customer_reviews.text: It was described to fit the Dregnout guitar by fender.. the bag is way too small.
customer_reviews.author: Amy B

customer_reviews.title: No fit fender acustic
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if they sent me the wrong one, but this is not for acustic guitars, it appears different in the picture but is not the case
customer_reviews.author: miguel

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: exactly as described! love the pocket in front, i keep my notebook in there. love the colors and it’s plenty of space for my dreadnought guitar. love it!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great Case!
customer_reviews.text: My son needed a case for school. It goes back and forth with ease. Great value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Coffee Dreams

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to carry and fits my bass and extra stuff in the pockets very well.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Fender Case arrived as indicated. Case is very durable and encases Fender Bass Guitar very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: buster4236

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the $$$...
customer_reviews.text: With the exception of the dead, mashed, cockroach in the box. The bag is a decent gig bag for $30 bucks. A bit light on the padding but again, only $30. Gets the job done. Now I just gotta get another one since I threw this one out as to avoid a roach infestation. But I get all warehouses have roaches.
customer_reviews.author: OK Computer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought it. It was good, but I returned it. Because my doughter's guitar was a little bit big.
customer_reviews.author: Faruk

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality/value
customer_reviews.text: Not using it on a regular basis yet but it looks like it will do the trick when needed.
customer_reviews.author: snowflashdrop

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Great bag fit the price. No complaints just wish the padding was thicker. I will need to be aware on myself when traveling with it.
customer_reviews.author: Oscentatious

customer_reviews.title: Great gig bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a damn nice gig bag for the price you’re paying. Fits my Jazz Bass nice and snug. The material overall seems pretty decent quality, and has a built in zipped pouch on the side that I put picks, cables, and straps in. My only gripe with this is the straps for wearing this on your back aren’t very comfortable at all. But it’s a cheap gig bag and it does it’s job well.
customer_reviews.author: Vance

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for your money
customer_reviews.text: This is Fender so that right there says a lot. Holds your bass and also, electric guitar. It isn't a hardcase so you still want to be careful handling the bag if you have your instrument in it. Otherwise, it's an awesome bag for your bass/electric guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Decent bag.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for a dreadnought. I bought it to use for an Epiphone Wildkat. It wouldn't fit in a regular electric bag. Functions fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy and no protection. Zipper broke upon opening. Not great quality
customer_reviews.author: jpmaes0622

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: My Son needed a bag for his bass. This one fit perfectly. Uses all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Marne

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good case for the price. Fits my Kramer ZX70 bass well especially with the angled headstock. Not very padded but good for what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit a Strat very well.
customer_reviews.text: This case BARELY fit my Strat. I took it out of the packaging and immediately put my guitar in there. Had to pull the zippered sides together super tight just to get it to close. The zipper on the front pocket is stiff and hard to operate. Returning it for a refund. Sincerely, - Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Fender Gig Bag for small Guitars.
customer_reviews.text: Get a larger one if you have a Les Paul clone.!No wiggle room at all. ITS well made ,should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: netgearhead

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit, low on padding.
customer_reviews.text: Used with 1999 Squire Strat model. Tight fit. Could use more padding in case, and on shoulder straps. Zipper should open to allow case to open completely.
customer_reviews.author: Organ Grinder

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Is big enough for my dreadnought. Very nicely made and great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described; excellent value and quality of materials
customer_reviews.text: Size and padding perfect for my folk guitar; wrap-around zipper provides easy access and secure closure
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is...
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive and simple, be warned that there is no padding in this bag. It could roll up and easily fit into a backpack or suitcase. May be well suited as a temporary tote, but not for regular travel use. Roomy front pocket, decent zippers. Personally, I would not purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Lynyrd Nimoy

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garabge.
customer_reviews.text: Got Torn after 3 months of using once a week
customer_reviews.author: Music Ear

customer_reviews.title: perfect.
customer_reviews.text: guitar fits. great protection for just sitting against the wall. I will not be traveling with it.
customer_reviews.author: doodle

customer_reviews.title: Simple cheap and effective
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for most electric bass guitars. The "backpack" style straps work very well, and are easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Yamaha perfectly! Holds up well. And the pocket is plenty roomy for the extras I need to carry: harmonicas, picks, lyrics and sheet music, etc.
customer_reviews.author: MyName

customer_reviews.title: this is a nice tight fit
customer_reviews.text: this bag is a good bag for moving you guitar around. practical and you can fold it up if necessary
customer_reviews.author: pjf

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money could use a bit more padding
customer_reviews.text: Good for the money could use a bit more padding
customer_reviews.author: Bruce R. Greene

customer_reviews.title: Good case!
customer_reviews.text: We love the looks of it, it protects the guitar well. I only wish it were vinyl to keep the rain out.
customer_reviews.author: mom&nurse72

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality bag.
customer_reviews.text: Fits a Fender CD60S perfectly. Adequate padding. Outer zippered pocket. More than I hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fixit

customer_reviews.title: This is a great guitar case. I’ve had it for several weeks and it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great guitar case. It protects the instrument well, and is easy to transport.
customer_reviews.author: Anders S Tune

customer_reviews.title: Great even after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money and hasn’t failed me yet after 9 months
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This is nice, but it is not a hard case. It's a gig bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the gig bag
customer_reviews.text: I love the gig bag! Fit my bass perfectly! Also comes with a pocket for cables or whatever else. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and quality!
customer_reviews.text: Just starting to learn to play, and teacher is amazed at quality of sound. Upgrade the strings and you’ve got a great value!
customer_reviews.author: Trenton

customer_reviews.title: Decent case
customer_reviews.text: It's a good case but it doesn't zip up around my tuners pegs on my fender jazz bass. Other than that it does the job going across town to a buddies to jam.
customer_reviews.author: kaleb

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with the quality of this case for the price that I paid.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kessler

customer_reviews.title: Nice gig bag
customer_reviews.text: Nice gig bag to keep dust off guitar and carry to lessons.
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: Wayyyy too small.
customer_reviews.text: Probably shouldn’t have “Bass” in the title. Better fit for Strat mini than anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Mildenberger

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is just what I needed no more no less.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's very good
customer_reviews.text: It's this is a well-made bass case at a budget price...
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Good case
customer_reviews.text: Shipped fast. This was a Christmas gift for my fiancé. He likes it, it’s a super lightweight alternative to his chunky hard case he has now. My only complaint is the straps should be a little longer, he’s pretty tall so it fits a little awkwardly.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Just what i needed! Fit my Squier J Bass snug and perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Granada

customer_reviews.title: great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: if you are looking for a compact, great quality bag, this one is right! with a small pocket to keep your strap and cable.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag for the $$
customer_reviews.text: The bag is great, not great that it took like a month to get to me...but it's fine; we people these days are so impatient and what it all today if not tomorrow. This item...it is worth the wait.
customer_reviews.author: J.Norris

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISSAPOINTED IN QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: PRODUCT WAS DESCRIBED AS "PADDED" TO PROTECT INSTRUMENT. IT WAS SO THIN, I JUST THREW IT IN MY CLOSET AND BOUGHT A MUCH THICKER PADDED CASE FOR A MUCH CHEAPER PRICE. ALSO, YOU SAID IT WAS PUT DIRECTLY IN MY HANDS: IT WAS NOT. IT WAS LEFT ON MY PORCH
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great bag for my son to keep his guitar in. It has a zipper pouch big enough to hold his music and picks. It also is easy to carry and can be carries with a handle or as a backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Shaunna Ludlow

customer_reviews.title: Great Case! Nice and durable for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I already had one of these cases and wanted another for my tele. It is a very durable case. Nice and slim so it fits in lots of places.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: this was for my granddaughter she got a bass guitar for Christmas and the case fits great and she liked it
customer_reviews.author: annalee

customer_reviews.title: All in all
customer_reviews.text: Very nice case, fits bass guitar perfectly. Only wish it had a little more padding. Love the carrying options it has. Backpack or hand held. All in all works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The gig bag arrived on time, the marterial is sturdy Perfect fit for my 5 string bass guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Blackks

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. Fender name only, but terrible quality.
customer_reviews.text: Zipper broke a few weeks after using it. The outside material is beginning to frey. Not a nice gig bag.
customer_reviews.author: robbbbb

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest but you cannot beat it for the money
customer_reviews.author: BF1865

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Zippers, size, material are all perfect. Using it for an electric guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina M

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: love the bag would deal with them again for sure
customer_reviews.author: scott dorsey

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag
customer_reviews.text: Its a bag a nice one what else to say.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, modern and beautiful. I recommend this product and the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Ngunza C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: What an excellent gig bag for excellent price. Get one now !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel Colon Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Very good case
customer_reviews.text: This case is awesome for bigger basses and it.has a good amount of padding. It was great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mfjap813

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The bag is nice. Not the best quality, but is definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the bottom of the bag does not have any extra ...
customer_reviews.text: the bottom of the bag does not have any extra foam, or support. If you lower your bass any slower than a koala, it may damage your bass. Other than that, it's an ok bag.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Cheon

customer_reviews.title: It's an ok bag, but my sweetie, who ...
customer_reviews.text: It's an ok bag, but my sweetie, who received it as a gift, says it rides a bit high on his back when carried on his back.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Quality is very good. Not the thickest padding out there but for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a real Fender gig bag. My 1995 Jazz bass slipped right in with no problems. Quality is very good. Not the thickest padding out there but for the price this is definitely a must grab gig bag!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Breen

customer_reviews.title: Ohhh that smell. Don’t you smell that smell. The smell that surrounds you!
customer_reviews.text: Stinks to high heaven, crazy plasticy smell. I washed it in the washer, while it is subdued it is still there. I am using this for my cheap spare guitar I keep at work when we play after work every week. I wouldn’t keep this at home. It’s a real shame because it is really nicely made and looks great. The padding is pretty nice, not extreme or anything. I can’t believe nobody mentioned how bad it smells. Ugh!
customer_reviews.author: Damnatron

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping! I’m happy with my purchase...the bag is a bit thinner than I expected but it’ll get the job done for now as I’m just a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ed.

customer_reviews.title: Love the front pocket
customer_reviews.text: Fits my base perfectly. The front pocket is really convenient. I use it for cords and/or my folder from my music lessons!
customer_reviews.author: lavenialivinglife

product_meta.title: Fender FA405 Multi-Fit Dreadnought Acoustic Guitar Gig Bag
product_meta.description: The release of the new Fender F405 series gig bags ushers in a new era of affordable, portable, and durable gig bag design to help keep your the release of the new Fender F405 series gig bags ushers in a new era of affordable, portable, and durable gig bag design to help keep your instrument protected while on the go. Constructed of 400 denier polyester and insulated by 5mm of padding, your investment is always well protected.
feature_bullets: 5 mm of padding to keep your instrument safe
Ergonomic backpack straps with easy adjustable ladder lock buckles

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars125 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
